text: the intense Russian air campaign in
Syria continues apace the latest targets
according to the Russian military
including Isis positions in Aleppo and
the town of Palmyra the town lies next
to this world-famous
archaeological site which is being
systematically destroyed by the
jihadists but Russia's military action
is increasingly controversial with
confirmation now that it's Jets have
twice flown into the airspace of
neighboring Turkey where they were
intercepted by Turkish warplanes and
forced out this violation of airspace
has been condemned by NATO as extremely
dangerous and irresponsible for us this
doesn't look as an accident this is a
serious violation of the airspace and
actually there were two violations
during the weekend so that just adds to
the fact that this doesn't look like an
accident these concerns are shared by
the United States Secretary of State
John Kerry is warning that if Russia
persists it could lead to a very serious
incident we're greatly concerned about
it because it is precisely the kind of
thing that had Turkey responded under
its rights could have resulted in a
shoot down and it is precisely the kind
of thing that we warned against
but at the Russian operation center in
Moscow the view is that the airspace
violations were accidental not
deliberate and today a Russian official
told the BBC it was not just Russia
which needed to be careful I think that
every country should be responsible and
nobody should violate air of other
countries that's obvious but we all
should be very responsible especially in
these days with Russia's intervention
the skies above Syria have become
crowded with air forces from countries
with very different objectives it's
dangerous and the need for coordination
is now extremely urgent
